definition[0]: an agreement to sell a product before it has been completed
example[0]: The picture will at worst break even, based on presales of the film for various territories.
definition[1]: the price someone expects to get for a product, especially one sold at an AUCTION (=an occasion when something is sold to the person willing to pay most for it)
example[1]: The doll sold for $5100, more than 5 times its presale estimate of $800/$1000.
